Everyone has a good weekend. I returned from Agri and Igdir yesterday, which has boundaries to Azerbaijan, Armenia and Iran.
I was very happy to see the peace of both our cities and the mutual love between our citizens.
Mount Ararat is famous for its relevance to human history.
The height of Mount Ararat is 5137 meters and although it is not in June, it is as white as you can see. http://t.co/hzzhlldy
As we walked on Cumhuriyet Street in Agri, we chatted with the citizens in front of a kraathan. http://t.co/x0b1olak

Ishak Pasha Palace in Dogubeyazit is a masterpiece built in an eagle's nest. http://t.co/fnizegad
Built in the 17th century, the Palace is completely stone processing. The aesthetics in design, the symmetrical measures are wonderful. http://t.co/zn2maıpj
İshak Paşa Palace ... http://t.co/K0xDCH1x
Another square from Ishak Pasha Palace. http://t.co/rvm981mz

Then his works; I visited the tomb of Ahmed-i Hanî, the writer of Mem'u Zîn, who wrote in Kurdish, Turkish, Persian and Arabic
Ahmed-i Hani Tomb. http://t.co/qedxecdk
While I climbed Ishak Pasha Palace, the students of Sarigul Elementary School were waiting for me.
I stopped and took pictures with them. http://t.co/h4eorc8o
Today, I was really happy to see the web site of a school at the farthest point of Turkey, with photos and information about this visit.
